titleStmt.title: R. W. Brandon et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9446

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his excellency Beriah Magoffin governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully represent to your honor that at the last term of our Circuit Court in Grayson County there was a Judgement of sixty dollars and cost rendered in said court against Wade L Webster for keeping a tipling house Your petitioners being well acquainted with the case will state that it is truly a case for executive clemency said Webster is one of the poorest men in the Commonwealth of Kentucky having a wife and seven children having no way of supporting ^them^ only by days works
Your petitioners would further state that if said Webster's labor is taken from his family they are bound to suffer Your petitioners pray your honor that if it is consistent with your sense of duty you will omit said fine

R. W. Brandon
George thomason
N. C. Tilford Jr
W. N Tilford
Saml W Tate
William C McDaniel
Wm N Beauchamp
J P Wilkerson
thomas craig
